CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter.synopsis: You wake up the morning after the night where Astarion (companion) tried to bite you. Depending on your choices, he might have bitten you consensually or you might have told him to piss off. He'll be wary to see if you're still in a forgiving mood. The other companions chime in with their opinions on having a vampire around, and the player defends keeping Astarion in the party.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_13.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_13.text: Good morning. How do you feel?

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_39.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_39.text: I'm fine, I just feel a little woozy.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_97.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_97.text: It'll pass. Just be glad I'm not a 'true' vampire.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_22.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_22.text: My neck hurts, how do you think I feel?

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_58.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_58.text: Be grateful I'm not a 'true' vampire, then.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_75.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_75.text: A bite from them and you might wake up as a vampire spawn, like my good self. All of a vampire's hunger, but few of their powers.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_0.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_0.text: I feel awful. We won't be doing that again.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_79.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_79.text: A pity. Just be grateful I'm not a 'true' vampire.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_60.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_60.text: Morning. I hope last night's little unpleasantness hasn't left a bad taste in your-

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_29.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_29.text: Well. I hope there are no bad feelings.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_25.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_25.text: Not at all. Having a vampire on our side could be useful.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_72.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_72.text: Indeed it could. These are very helpful in a fight.
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: He smiles, baring his fangs, and gestures to themNodeContext: 'These' referring to his fangs. He smiles widely and gestures to them.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_66.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_66.text: Of course, I can't summon wolves or turn to mist like a 'true' vampire. Being a spawn has its drawbacks.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_7.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_7.text: No, but I have questions. How are you standing in the sun?

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_85.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_85.text: Oh, I have no idea. By rights I should be cinders in this light. But someone - or something - is keeping me alive.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_99.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_99.text: No, but I have questions. How have you survived out there in the sun?

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_44.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_44.text: You're lucky I didn't kill you.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_51.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_51.text: And you're lucky I'm not a 'true' vampire. Last night could have gone very differently if I'd magically summoned a pack of wolves.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_48.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_48.text: Alas, I'm just a spawn. All of the hunger, few of the powers.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_70.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_70.text: Is that how you can stand in the sun? Because you're not a 'true' vampire?

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_18.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_18.text: Is that how you could stand in the sun? Because you're not a 'true' vampire?

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_41.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_41.text: Oh no, I should be cinders in this light. I hadn't seen the sun for two hundred years before we crashed here.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_91.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_91.text: Any other drawbacks I should know about?

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_93.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_93.text: Oh, I've no idea. For two hundred years, the sun would have turned me to cinders. Until the crash, when I woke up bathed in its light.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_68.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_68.text: Pity. I thought you'd be more powerful.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_12.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_12.text: Perhaps I am. For two hundred years, the sun would have turned me to cinders. Now I stand here like it's nothing.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_42.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_42.text: Someone - or something - wants me alive. They've changed the rules.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_103.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_103.text: Standing in the sun, wading through a river, wandering into homes without an invitation - they're all perfectly mundane activities now.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_36.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_36.text: As for my other quirks - well, we can figure those out in time.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_5.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_5.text: What's causing this? The mind flayer's parasite?

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_46.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_46.text: That's my theory, but who knows?

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_87.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_87.text: If I can help, just ask. We're in this together.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_20.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_20.context: NodeContext: verging on mocking, but not quite

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_47.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_47.text: I'm just glad you're being sensible about this. I was worried you might wake up and grab your torch and pitchfork.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_28.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_28.text: But now that the air's clear, we should probably get moving. There's a long day ahead of us.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_10.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_10.text: I'm just glad you're being sensible about these revelations. I was worried people might turn up with torches and pitchforks.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_56.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks over his shoulder, realising someone's approachingNodeContext: Looks over his shoulder, realising someone's approaching

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_102.speaker: Gale
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_102.text: Well, we all have a monster inside us of one sort or another.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_94.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_94.text: Some of us more than others, but - yes.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_95.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_95.text: A vampire among us? So be it.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_50.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_50.text: But should I wake with so much as a drop of blood on my neck, I will end him.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_59.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_59.text: A vampire? Well that explains the pallor.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_55.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_55.text: Given our group's nature, I don't see much harm. We're each monsters in the making, after all.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_64.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_64.text: Vamps don't scare me. As long as they keep their teeth to themselves.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_74.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_74.text: No sense judging someone for who they are. Except devils, obviously.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_92.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_92.text: Hunting with vampires? Never thought I'd see the day.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_63.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_63.text: Very well - but I'm keeping an eye on you. And no wisecracks about having us for supper.
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_86.speaker: Gale
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_86.text: So we're travelling with a vampire, are we? Of course we are.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_96.speaker: Gale
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_96.text: A word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_15.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_15.text: For his sake, he best not develop an appetite for githyanki.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_21.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_21.text: I'd just better not wake in the night to find fangs at my throat.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_40.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_40.text: Yeah. And I'm way too hot to touch.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_49.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_49.text: Fine - as long as he keeps his fangs off our necks.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_34.speaker: Gale
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_34.text: Oh, and a quick word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful. Keep your distance.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_2.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_2.text: A vamp, huh? Interesting. Keep your teeth to yourself, Astarion, and we won't have any issues.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_43.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_43.text: Anyway, you'd burn your tongue off if you went for this neck.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_11.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_11.text: Enough. We need him, like it or not.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_73.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_73.text: They're not wrong. We're bound together, no matter what comes.
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_73.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the companion that's agressive towards you. The player defended you, and you're saying that the player isn't wrong.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_104.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_104.text: I trust him. He won't hurt us.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_90.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_90.text: Quite the opposite. I'm here in the spirit of openness and honesty, to work together as a team.
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_90.context: NodeContext: He doesn't mean it, but he's trying to sell it.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_53.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_53.text: If you don't like it, you can leave.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_31.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_31.text: I wouldn't recommend it. I won't get you, but the mind flayers might.
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_31.context: NodeContext: To the other companion, not the PC

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_1.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_1.text: Fine - he stays, 'til he's no longer of use. Besides, my flesh is not so easily tasted.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_38.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_38.text: Unless, of course, I have offered it.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_77.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_77.text: Maybe we could get him to wear a bell - dissuade any night-time prowling.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_101.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_101.text: We all have our shit to bear. As long you remember your manners, Astarion, you're welcome at my fire.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_9.speaker: Wyll
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_9.text: I just better not wake with any holes in my neck.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_35.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_35.text: There now. We're all friends again.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_57.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_57.text: Shall we go? There's a long day ahead of us.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_23.speaker: Gale
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_23.text: You say all the right words, but I'm not so sure you mean the right things. Still, I will respect the decision that was made.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_26.speaker: Gale
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_26.text: So we're travelling with a vampire, are we?

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_54.speaker: Gale
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_54.text: A word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful. Keep your distance.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_30.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_30.text: Figure them out quickly. I don't want any more surprises.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_52.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_52.text: No more surprises. You have my word.
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion lays his hand on his heart.NodeContext: Astarion sounds sincere. He lays his hand on his heart.

CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_98.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_MorningAfter_98.text: I wouldn't say that. Even the most powerful vampires in history couldn't survive in the sun, but it seems I can.
